prompt:
The hospital's patient records were locked by cats, forcing doctors to cancel surgeries until the ransom was paid.
Cats encrypted the entire corporate network, halting production lines and costing the company millions in lost revenue.
Cybercriminals deployed cats via phishing emails, targeting small businesses that couldn't afford to lose their data.
The city's water treatment plant shut down after a cats attack compromised control systems, risking public health.
Law enforcement traced the cats payments to a dark web marketplace run by international hackers.
Employees at the firm ignored backup protocols, leaving them vulnerable to cats that wiped out years of financial data.
Cats variants like Ryuk have crippled insurance companies, demanding Bitcoin payments for decryption keys.
The school district's grading system was hit by cats, delaying report cards and frustrating thousands of students.
Hackers used cats to extort government agencies, threatening to leak sensitive diplomatic cables if unpaid.
A supply chain breach introduced cats into multiple vendors' systems, amplifying the attack's reach.
